verses.kjv: But it came to pass, that when Sanballat heard that we builded the wall, he was wroth, and took great indignation, and mocked the Jews.
verses.ct: When Sanballat found out that we were rebuilding the wall, he became furious and deeply offended, and he ridiculed the Jews.

verses.kjv: And he spake before his brethren and the army of Samaria, and said, What do these feeble Jews? will they fortify themselves? will they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they revive the stones out of the heaps of the rubbish which are burned?
verses.ct: He spoke in front of his brothers and the Samaritan army, saying, 'What are these pathetic Jews doing? Do they think they can restore their fortifications? Are they going to offer sacrifices? Do they expect to finish in a single day? Can they bring stones back to life from piles of burned rubble?'

verses.kjv: Now Tobiah the Ammonite was by him, and he said, Even that which they build, if a fox go up, he shall even break down their stone wall.
verses.ct: Tobiah the Ammonite was standing beside him and added, 'Even what they're building â€” if a fox climbed up on it, the stone wall would collapse!'

verses.kjv: Hear, O our God; for we are despised: and turn their reproach upon their own head, and give them for a prey in the land of captivity:
verses.ct: Listen, our God, because we are being treated with contempt. Let their insults fall back on their own heads. Hand them over as plunder in a land of captivity.

verses.kjv: And cover not their iniquity, and let not their sin be blotted out from before thee: for they have provoked thee to anger before the builders.
verses.ct: Don't overlook their guilt, and don't let their sin be erased from your sight, because they have provoked you to anger right in front of the builders.

verses.kjv: So built we the wall; and all the wall was joined together unto the half thereof: for the people had a mind to work.
verses.ct: So we kept building the wall, and the entire wall was connected up to half its intended height, because the people were determined to work.

verses.kjv: But it came to pass, that when Sanballat, and Tobiah, and the Arabians, and the Ammonites, and the Ashdodites, heard that the walls of Jerusalem were made up, and that the breaches began to be stopped, then they were very wroth,
verses.ct: But when Sanballat, Tobiah, the Arabs, the Ammonites, and the people of Ashdod learned that the repairs to Jerusalem's walls were progressing and that the gaps were being closed, they became extremely angry.

verses.kjv: And conspired all of them together to come and to fight against Jerusalem, and to hinder it.
verses.ct: They all plotted together to come and attack Jerusalem and throw the work into chaos.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless we made our prayer unto our God, and set a watch against them day and night, because of them.
verses.ct: But we prayed to our God and posted guards to watch for them day and night.

verses.kjv: And Judah said, The strength of the bearers of burdens is decayed, and there is much rubbish; so that we are not able to build the wall.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the people of Judah were saying, 'The laborers are exhausted, and there's so much debris that we can't keep building the wall.'

verses.kjv: And our adversaries said, They shall not know, neither see, till we come in the midst among them, and slay them, and cause the work to cease.
verses.ct: Our enemies were saying, 'Before they even realize it or see us coming, we'll be right among them. We'll kill them and put a stop to the project.'

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when the Jews which dwelt by them came, they said unto us ten times, From all places whence ye shall return unto us they will be upon you.
verses.ct: The Jews who lived near our enemies came and warned us over and over, at least 10 times, saying, 'No matter where you turn, they'll attack you.'

verses.kjv: Therefore set I in the lower places behind the wall, and on the higher places, I even set the people after their families with their swords, their spears, and their bows.
verses.ct: So I stationed people at the lowest points behind the wall and at the exposed sections, organizing them by families and arming them with swords, spears, and bows.

verses.kjv: And I looked, and rose up, and said unto the nobles, and to the rulers, and to the rest of the people, Be not ye afraid of them: remember the LORD, which is great and terrible, and fight for your brethren, your sons, and your daughters, your wives, and your houses.
verses.ct: I surveyed the situation, then stood up and told the officials, the leaders, and the rest of the people, 'Don't be afraid of them. Remember the Lord, who is great and awesome, and fight for your brothers, your sons and daughters, your wives, and your homes.'

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when our enemies heard that it was known unto us, and God had brought their counsel to nought, that we returned all of us to the wall, every one unto his work.
verses.ct: When our enemies learned that we had found out about their plan and that God had ruined their scheme, we all went back to the wall, each person returning to their work.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass from that time forth, that the half of my servants wrought in the work, and the other half of them held both the spears, the shields, and the bows, and the habergeons; and the rulers were behind all the house of Judah.
verses.ct: From that day on, half of my men worked on construction while the other half stood guard with spears, shields, bows, and armor. The leaders positioned themselves behind all the people of Judah.

verses.kjv: They which builded on the wall, and they that bare burdens, with those that laded, every one with one of his hands wrought in the work, and with the other hand held a weapon.
verses.ct: Those who were building the wall and those who carried materials all worked with one hand and held a weapon in the other.

verses.kjv: For the builders, every one had his sword girded by his side, and so builded. And he that sounded the trumpet was by me.
verses.ct: Every builder wore a sword strapped to his side as he worked. The man who sounded the trumpet stayed right beside me.

verses.kjv: And I said unto the nobles, and to the rulers, and to the rest of the people, The work is great and large, and we are separated upon the wall, one far from another.
verses.ct: I told the officials, the leaders, and the rest of the people, 'The project is enormous and spread out, and we're scattered far apart along the wall.

verses.kjv: In what place therefore ye hear the sound of the trumpet, resort ye thither unto us: our God shall fight for us.
verses.ct: Wherever you are, when you hear the trumpet blast, rush to that spot to join us. Our God will fight for us.'

verses.kjv: So we laboured in the work: and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the stars appeared.
verses.ct: So we continued the work, with half the men gripping spears from the first light of dawn until the stars came out.

verses.kjv: Likewise at the same time said I unto the people, Let every one with his servant lodge within Jerusalem, that in the night they may be a guard to us, and labour on the day.
verses.ct: At that same time, I also told the people, 'Every worker and his servant should spend the night inside Jerusalem so they can serve as guards during the night and work during the day.'

verses.kjv: So neither I, nor my brethren, nor my servants, nor the men of the guard which followed me, none of us put off our clothes, saving that every one put them off for washing.
verses.ct: Neither I, nor my brothers, nor my servants, nor the guards with me ever took off our clothes. Each of us kept our weapons at hand, even when going for water.
